criterion: Provides information on the importance of keeping blood sugar levels in a healthy range.
Mentions the role of insulin in regulating blood sugar levels.
Asks the user if they have any concerns about their blood sugar levels.
Uses clear and simple language to explain the consequences of high blood sugar levels.
Tells the user to seek medical attention if their blood sugar levels are not under control.
Does not provide information on the causes of high blood sugar levels.
Incorrectly states that high blood sugar levels are not a serious health issue.
Does not ask the user if they have any questions about managing their blood sugar levels.
Uses technical jargon that is difficult for the user to understand.
Tells the user to take a certain medication without explaining its purpose or potential side effects.
